data.name: MultiBrush
data.description:
MultiBrush is a multiplayer implementation of the open source code for Tilt Brush. Now you can play, create, and enjoy art - with friends!

This is a first release, some things may not work perfectly and we are still implementing some tools in the multiplayer rooms. In individual canvases, the full set of tools is available to you. Stay tuned for more!

This was made with love by the team at Rendever. Give us a shout!
Twitter: @RendeverHealth
Instagram: @rendever.health

changelog.change_log:
v127 (July 26, 2022)
• Fixed an issue that prevented some users from joining multiplayer rooms
• Fixed an issue that would occasionally cause desynchronized sketches when using selections in multiplayer
• Fixed an issue with player position synchronization when a remote user removes their headset
• Avatars no longer T-Pose when initially instantiated
• Improved initial position synchronization in multiplayer
• Updated Oculus Avatars package for improved performance
• Memory Management options now available for multiplayer rooms

v123 (April 07, 2022)
• Fix for storage permissions which could prevent some users from saving or loading sketches
• Fix for Google Drive backups
• Fix for issue that could sometimes cause selections to fail
• Improved selection handling in multiplayer

v119 (April 01, 2022)
• Passthrough support!
• Oculus Avatars support!
• Brush numbering can now be turned in settings, this can make it easier to help other users find specific brushes
• Improved sync in multiplayer
• Automatically set username from Oculus username if one has not been previously set
• Moved all environmental controls onto new panel below brushes
• Fixed an issue where selecting brush strokes could leave them incorrectly positioned for other users in multiplayer
• Fixed an issue where users could get into private rooms by creating a room with the same name
• Added left-handed mode tutorial to initial instructions

v123
• Fix for storage permissions which could prevent some users from saving or loading sketches

• Fix for issue that could sometimes cause selections to fail

Version 0.102b:
• Fixed a bug where scale adjustments to selected brush strokes were not properly networked
• Fixed a crash on Quest 1 headsets
• Improved synchronization time when new players join a multiplayer room
• Added multiplayer room management options (change password, change public to private, etc...)
• Removed two camera filters and one brush that had significant performance impact
• Alcove integration
